basics.name: Derick Olson-Chan
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a full stack web developer with 5+ years of experience building and shipping apps for millions of users. I've mostly worked with startups and am used to wearing multiple hats. I focus on product experience and prioritize feedback from users and non-technical teammates. I’m passionate about empowering people to create and share their stories. I'm seeking a role at intersection of technology, books, and creative education.

work.summary: Need help with a project? Drop me a line. I'm based in Cambridge, MA and am available for short and long-term freelance work.
highlights: Professional services: React/Next apps, Personal sites, Typescript, API integrations, and GraphQL servers.
Hobby projects: I'm open to collborating on projects involving: generative fiction, digital books, and education.
Currently Learning: React Native

work.summary: As a graduate instructor in UVA's Creative Writing program, I taught multiple sections of undergrads, helping students discover what, how, and why they write.
highlights: Taught semester-long undergraduate English courses in Fiction, Personal Narrative, and Composition.
Lectured and facilitated peer review and workshops, covering topics from Experimental Fiction to Personal Memoir.
Supported student applications for Area Program in Prose and the Writer's Eye contest for Ekphrastic Writing.

work.summary: 1stDibs is a marketplace for one-of-a-kind items with 5M+ monthly visitors. As a JavaScript developer on the Core Engagement and International teams, I wrote key integrations to launch the Internationalized eCommerce site.
highlights: Shipped responsive Mobile Web UX across Search / Browse / Product Detail Pages using React, Scss, and React Storybook.
Shipped 'Discover Page' by taking a Company Hack-a-thon prototype to production to launch 1stDibs' first personalized recommendation engine using React, Relay, and GraphQL on Node.
Built automated translations system for launch of International websites in: Germany, France, & UK using React-Intl, Node scripts, Smartling API, Github API, and Jenkins build server.
Organized onsite Student Hack-a-thon with students from three NYC Public High Schools, internal stakeholders, and a team of volunteer teachers from CodeNation
Re-built login modals and sign-up flows across site to support new user account types for increased engagement and decreased time to first sale.
Built location-based recommendations and filters to connect buyers and sellers from closer locales
Re-wrote internal tooling for A/B tests and SEO optimizations, improving Product-Developer time to launch across teams.
Technologies: React, Node, GraphQL, SEO+AMP, A/B Testing, i18n, GitHub Integrations, Mobile Web, Server-Side Rendering.

work.summary: Remind helps students, teachers, and parents safely communicate in K-12 schools. As a Product Engineer on the Core Engagement team, I worked across the stack to ship features support a user base of 20M+ monthly users.
highlights: React, GraphQL, Node, Ruby on Rails, Go, AWS, Docker, and CircleCI.
Full-stack implementation of reaction emojis for Message Reactions, File Uploading, and Message Composition.
Participated in monthly 48 hour on-call rotation to monitor backend infrastructure and front end services
Contributed to team-wide adoption of modern javascript frameworks: Apollo GraphQL, Redux, and React
Re-wrote Twilio integration for modern JavaScript and Node (no more callbacks!)
Successfully ran a multi-week migration from Rails-based PostgreSQL to Go service built on DynamoDB with zero downtime.
Shipped profile photo uploads, cropping, and storage using React, Apollo GraphQL, and AWS S3.

work.summary: Foursquare is a location-based social network with 50M+ monthly users with a recommendations platform leveraging the power of geolocation. As a data engineering intern, I learned a ton from a team of Data Scientists. I supported the in-house Machine Learning pipeline using Scalding and Luigi MapReduce frameworks, improving Scala server performance, and created internal tools for the product team.
highlights: Implemented 'Recently Viewed Venues' feature for LambdaMART learning-to-rank model.
Improved product-engineering communication by creating internal dashboard for testing location models.
Re-wrote notifications pipeline in Scala to fetch data in concurrent stages.
Decreased machine utilization by batching service calls for similar notifications.

work.summary: I was a teaching assistant for several undergraduate courses, including: Functional Programming, Data Structures, and Theory of Computation.
highlights: Java, OCaml, LaTeX, and Javascript.
Led weekly presentations and assignments for groups 20-students.
Provided one-on-one mentorship on homework and exam preparation.
Assisted professors in various tasks such as improving course documentation, assignment updates, and grading exams.
Designed, implemented, and deployed the company landing page.
Served as primary liason between non-technical founder and software contractors for web and iOS apps.

work.summary: Cross-functional intern working with members of IT and Marketing teams for a financial consulting firm.
highlights: Objective-C, Core Data, Swift, and SQLite.
Built iOS app (凯盛汇/KaiShengHui) for consultants to read and share in-house industry news, find new projects, find and RSVP to events, and view profile and existing project updates.
Collaborated with all-Chinese Marketing and Design teams to define application requirements.
Designed and implemented networking client backed by Core Data to persist JSON responses to local SQLite.

volunteer.summary: Writing group based in NYC and online
highlights: Co-run bi-weekly meetings with 9 writers of fiction, essay, and poetry.
Workshopped and edited 100+ pieces of writing including 3 novels, 1 essay collection, and dozens of short stories and poems.
Helped colleagues with submissions to literary journals and contests, resulting in 10+ publications.
Assisted colleagues with MFA applications, resulting in acceptances to top programs.

volunteer.summary: Helped setup mobile cafe in farmer's markets across Charlottesville, VA and assisted in the cafe / roastery.
Helped bean-to-bar chocolate maker in Exeter, NH improve cafe experience with specialty drinks, tastings, and customer service.
Helped local specialty coffee shop in Exeter, NH during employee shortage.
Taught web development fundamentals (js/html/css) to high school students in Brooklyn (Uncommon Charter) and Manhattan (Seward Park Campus, Essex, LoMa, Dual-Language)
highlights: Hosted Student/Teacher Hack-a-thon at 1stdibs HQ
Led in-person Ekphrastic workshops based on a tour of museum galleries
Selected winners from 300+ entries for the Ekphrastic Poetry and Fiction for the Fralin Museum of Art's annual 'Writer's Eye' contest
Helped with daily opening and closing of studio 2-3 times per week.
Helped owners with moving logistics and setup of new studio in Gowanus, Brooklyn

volunteer.summary: Resident Yoga Teacher at an urban ashram in San Francisco.
highlights: Completed 200-hour yoga teacher training during four month residence.
Led twice-weekly Hath Yoga classes.
Led Agnihotra fire ceremony, chanting, and meditation 3-4 times per week
Led three workshops on meditative Breathwork.
Respresented the US at oikos International Presidents' Meet gathering in St. Gallen, Switzerland
Organized a sustainable micro-brewery tour at Yards Brewing company in Philadelphia, PA
Organized pop-up farmers' market at Penn, featuring local and organic produce.

projects.name: Open Meditations Podcast
projects.summary: I used to lead short meditations at the office at 1stdibs. After a time, I decided start a podcast. I leaned into the technical constraints of a noisy NYC apartment by opting to record everything outside, letting the sounds of the city become part of the experience.
highlights: Audio: recording with a lavier mic + iPhone
Mixing: Ferrite App
Visuals: Pixelmator
Web presence: static react app on S3
Social: Instagram @openmeditations
Hosting + distribution: Podbean
